sentence.Network_en: I looked at him, at the long, bony , almost Lincolnesque face.
sentence.Network_cn: 我瞅着他, 瞅着他那张颇象林肯的脸庞,长长的脸棱角外露.

sentence.Network_en: Etheridge, who was tall, slightly stooped and cultivated a Lincolnesque image.
sentence.Network_cn: 埃思里奇个头很高, 微微有些驼背,修养成一种林肯式的风姿.

means.word_mean: 1. of or relating to or in the manner of Abraham Lincoln

auth_sentence.content: And after making the pledge to appoint a Lincolnesque "team of rivals, " Obama nominated Sen.

auth_sentence.content: Even libertarian Ron Paul, who long resisted injecting faith into politics, has waxed Lincolnesque this season.
